item.title: Solutions
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
Home
    What we do
    Products
    Solutions
    Clients
    Solutions
    Products
    Tech
    Company
SOLUTIONS
Sixgill can help your business embrace mobility and gain control of your evolving connected and mobile world. Your workforce and critical assets are in motion more than ever before, creating opportunities and challenges throughout your business.

The ability to track, determine, and act in this mobile world is becoming a critical enterprise need. Sixgill automates the proximity data services necessary to support the complete spectrum of problem-solving packaged and custom mobility applications proliferating across the enterprise.
PEOPLE - "Proximity for People"
People are at the heart of your business. They are constantly moving, within your facilities and outside. Making them productive, motivated, and safe is a key driver of business success.
Sixgill provides you the ability to harness this mobility, turning it into a business asset. By understanding the location of your workforce and the proximity of people to the things that matter, you can make them more productive, accountable, efficient and safe.
Whether providing individual direction to an employee or understanding the movements of your entire team, Sixgill can assist you.
Here are a few examples of how Sixgill can help:

  • Provide wayfinding for employees on a corporate campus, including the ability to find key colleagues and deliver content to orient them to current context in real-time
  • Optimize home location for a sales or service team based on an analysis of historical team location and movements
  • Know where a critical employee is right now or verify that employees are where they are supposed to be
  • Understand where employees are in the event of an emergency and send targeted guidance to individuals based on their location and attributes
  • Let employees know when they are entering restricted areas
  • Trigger specific safety messages to employees when they enter hazardous areas
  • Validate and store movement data for analysis, audit, and compliance needs
ASSETS - "Proximity for Assets
Today, business assets and equipment are increasingly connected and mobile. Understanding their location and proximity to key people and locations is key to unlocking their effectiveness. Tomorrow, the ability to effectively manage a constellation of connected assets will become critical to being competitive.

With the emergence of asset connectivity due to the Internet of Things revolution, Sixgill simplifies the ability to track, determine, and act on the location and proximity of this key driver of business value.

Here are a few examples of how Sixgill can help:

  • Know where critical equipment or inventory is right now and verify that employees are where they are supposed to be
  • Connect the location of key equipment with people who need it based on their proximity and attributes
  • Get notified when valuable assets are moved from a building or a controlled access area
  • Analyze the movement of assets to gain insight into whether things are where they need to be
CROWDS - “Proximity for Crowds
When crowds of people assemble at events, it always presents a set of unique challenges. How should they be directed? What safety precautions should be taken? How can you market to them effectively?

Sixgill can provide immediate feedback on crowd behaviors as well as a mechanism to communicate context specific information, guidance and offers.

A sample of the wide variety of benefits that Sixgill can provide includes:

  • Understand how to optimize the event setup based on real-time and historical paths of attendees
  • Message important, context-sensitive information to attendees in the event of a safety concern. Sixgill can also detect sudden mass movements that might indicate an emergency and alert your security war room or authorities to investigate
  • Direct attendees toward optimal travel routes (or parking) based on real-time and historical location data
  • Trigger important information for attendees to enhance their experience including targeting promotions, event information, and weather alerts
  • Serve an event’s global interest constituency while selectively addressing sub-populations determined by proximities
Learn how Sixgill can help your business.
LEGAL   CONTACT
© Copyright Sixgill, 2016. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Product
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
PRODUCT

Sixgill’s cloud-based enterprise proximity platform enables your business to take control of your connected, mobile world and drive business value. From insightful analytics to precision actions based on the proximity of your people and mobile assets, Sixgill will make your business more productive and effective.

Track, Determine, Act

Sixgill Sense tracks, determines, and acts on the changing proximity of people, places, and things. Your world is complex. Today’s enterprise has an ever-expanding mobile workforce and increasingly sophisticated, connected assets. Sixgill Sense allows you to understand and harness this mobility and use it to your advantage, gaining awareness and insight, and driving contextual, proximity-based actions to make your organization safer, more productive and profitable.

TRACK YOUR MOBILE ENTERPRISE
Sixgill Sense integrates location and sensor data from your mobile workforce and assets, enabling insight and action on your mobile and connected enterprise. By using the the Sixgill Reach mobile SDK to connect your mobile app to Sixgill Sense, you can avoid expensive specialized location equipment and take advantage of Sixgill’s hybrid location and battery optimization features. Sixgill Sense can also incorporate any location-emitting connected devices or assets with onboard sensors.

  • Locate a person or an important connected asset
  • Get a view of where all of key people or connected assets are from the Sixgill dashboard, or use our Data API to utilize your existing analytics software for detailed analysis
  • Understand location history and migration patterns to optimize productivity and planning
DETERMINE PROXIMITY AND INTENT

The Sixgill Sense proximity engine combines location and sensor data with business intent to drive action on the proximity events that matter for your business. Users can configure or import key business rules for Sixgill Sense to monitor in real time. For even smarter proximity determinations, integrate your existing enterprise systems to incorporate user attributes, corporate policies or other important internal information.

  • Drive contextual, specific actions based on flexible set of rules, using user attributes, geospatial targeting, and contextual triggers
  • Combine your existing business systems, data and processes with new proximity awareness, to drive smarter actions
  • Utilize an array of predefined proximity circumstances and flexible location targeting, including wifi or beacon signals, points of interest, complex polygons, circles, and exclusion areas. Proximity presets include: Enter Area, Exit Area, In-Area, Out-of-Area, Device-to-Device
ACT TO DRIVE BUSINESS VALUE

Sixgill Sense can trigger actions from proximity knowledge that you need to accomplish your business goals. Whether the scenario calls for a message to a user, a critical piece of information logged into a corporate database, or an alert placed in another enterprise system, Sixgill Sense can do it. Trigger a push notification, send an email, serve content, or log data into your CRM system, for example. Sixgill’s open API can integrate with your existing applications, data repositories or other third party tools.

  • Utilize Sixgill’s integrated push notifications, text, or email to communicate high value, contextual messages. Customize messages singly or by group with sensed or assigned variables
  • Post updates or trigger business logic on your existing enterprise systems
  • Integrate with best-of-breed communications software

The Mobile SDK for Sixgill Sense

Your app is already powerful; add the power of proximity awareness with the Sixgill Reach mobile SDK. The Sixgill Reach integrates seamlessly within your mobile app, creating a channel for hybrid location and sensor data to be communicated to Sixgill Sense and enabling contextual triggered messaging through your application. The Sixgill Mobile SDK is available for iOS, Android and Windows Mobile today.

  • Derive highly accurate and reliable location and proximity from multiple sources including GPS, cellular network location, Wi-Fi access points, and Bluetooth beacons
  • Optimize device battery life through smart technology that considers business objectives, device location and proximity, and available location technologies

Professional Services for Proximity Enablement Our team follows a Sixgill process vetted by our multinational customers with proven success in speedy, scalable deployments.

  • Professional services
  • Data integrations
  • Application integrations
  • App development
  • Client success
  • SDK integration
  • Platform administration and reporting
  • Rules configuration

REQUEST A DEMO

Learn how Sixgill can help your business.
LEGAL   CONTACT
© Copyright Sixgill, 2016. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Tech
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
Technology
that simplifies your
world

Sixgill Sense technology was designed for the new mobile, distributed, connected workplace, where enterprise effectiveness will be determined in part by how effectively the burgeoning ad hoc mobility and continuous movement of people and assets are managed.

Sixgill combines a market-tested set of proximity technologies with an open architecture that allows enterprises to seamlessly integrate this new capability into existing business processes and software. The result is a proximity PaaS that provides both insight into the activity of the enterprise and a way to drive proximity-induced actions based on business goals.

Sixgill uses a multi-pronged location awareness approach to best determine people and asset location, including GPS, cellular network location, WiFi access points, and Bluetooth beacons. As new ways of determining location become available, Sixgill will support them.

Sixgill’s lightweight mobile SDK, Reach, turns an enterprise mobile application into a two-way proximity-informed app, able to pass location information to Sixgill for proximity determinations, and communicate relevant, contextual information to employees based on where they are. Sixgill Reach (iOS, Android, Windows Mobile) balances device battery life with responsiveness required by an anticipated proximity event. Sixgill can integrate signals from other connected devices as well, allowing for business goals around the proximity of people and key assets.
At the heart of Sixgill Sense is the ability to determine proximity circumstances from location data, and take appropriate action. Users define business outcomes that are triggered based on proximity determinations, other sensor data and user attributes. User attributes can be defined within Sixgill Sense or integrated via API.

When people, places or things enter, exit, or dwell within a landmark, Sixgill’s dynamic decision engine takes the right action, whether it’s one proximity event or millions to evaluate and act upon. Actions can reference a wide variety of signals, including complex polygons drawn on a map, imported lat/long data, connection to a specific WiFi access point, a given signal strength from a network beacon or access point, or any combination of these. The engine can also incorporate sequential events in the rules logic.
Sixgill Sense is designed to work with an enterprise’s existing systems along with existing and future location technologies. It is an agnostic, open platform that can integrate with a wide array of sensor and data inputs and virtually any activity service.

The rules engine can incorporate data and attributes from existing enterprise systems, as well as third party content for better decisions. On the output side, Sixgill can integrate with messaging and enterprise systems, internal databases or third party software to utilize existing processes.

Sixgill Sense APIs allow enterprises to utilize Sixgill Sense as a service in any device, OS or data environment. From defining business logic to driving specific actions to accessing proximity data, Sixgill APIs allow full access to the Sense proximity platform’s functionality.
Learn how Sixgill can help your business.
LEGAL   CONTACT
© Copyright Sixgill, 2016. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Company
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
THE COMPANY

Sixgill LLC is the enterprise redirection of the proximity software and data technology originally developed by Zos Communications LLC for its sponsor-to-attendee communications and crowd management projects for large events. Founded in 2007 by brothers Jon and Russ Ziskind, Zos Communications pioneered open architecture, device and data-ecumenical proximity services for smartphone apps, their users, and the brands interested in reaching them.

Sixgill Sense is the current cloud-based proximity software and data service derived from Zos Communications’ technology. It offers any company a single platform to enable all mobile apps and assets to be proximity-informed and automated for triggered actions. Through Zos’ prior projects business, Sense has proven robust and scalable, supporting millions of app users, processing billions of data points and generating over 25 million real-time actions triggered by proximity circumstances.

Recognizing explosive potential in the juggernaut trend toward mobile distribution of resources of all types in the enterprise and the need to reconcile rampant mobility with management control, the company in 2015 assembled new leadership experienced in large, B2B markets and platform services. Today, Sixgill LLC provides proximity service solutions for the full spectrum of enterprise mobility challenges, including mobile workforce orientation, management, deployment, health and security; process efficiency; tracking, protecting and deploying distributed assets; device-to-device communications and automation; mobile CRM; management and analysis of large population migration behaviors; and any geo-space conditional communications.

OUR TEAM

PHIL RESSLER
Chief Executive Officer
Phil has been serially involved in building companies and expanding markets for a wide range of innovators in enterprise data availability, comprehension and collaboration spanning the mobile, web, networking and PC eras.

His programs accelerated demand and market comprehension for early pioneers Lotus Development Corp., Nantucket Corp., Gupta Corp. inquiry.com and Callidus Software. He advised dozens of enterprise, communications, mobile and media start-ups during his work in venture capital at Clearstone Venture Partners, and returned to the operating world in 2008 as CEO at photorealistic animation innovator Big Stage Entertainment. He helped companies find focus and exits in collaborative accountability and analytic database markets, and led a product innovation and business revival as CEO at manufacturer Seymour Duncan during the Crash. After launching streaming data innovator Bottlenose into revenue and raising its Series B financing, Phil’s renewed interest in new data types with strategic value led him to reformulate Zos Communications as Sixgill LLC for the enterprise.

Learn More ∨
JEFF ESTER
Senior Vice President, Revenue
Jeff has built an extended career as the pioneering revenue strategist and instigator in early-stage companies just launching into ungelled markets where innovators find themselves on the cusp of explosive growth.

He has proven able to build and lead success-driving revenue teams and lay in selling infrastructure that gives young enterprise companies scale and growth. Jeff began his career learning disciplined enterprise sales at Oracle and took his newly-acquired expertise to then-startup Pure Software. He pioneered enterprise product sales for Netscape, continuing to serve AOL after acquisition. After over a decade incubating and advising a plethora of technology startups, Jeff returned to the operating world to build and lead the sales function at customer intelligence innovator EdgeTheory, prior to joining Zos Communications and its transformation into Sixgill.

Learn More ∨
MIKE HOROWITZ
Senior Vice President, Product Management & Engineering
If you use any of the popular cloud-based platform applications available on the web or bought an event ticket online, you’ve probably used something cool that Mike built or influenced.

As a product leader building innovative consumer and enterprise applications for mobile and the web, Mike has indirectly reached hundreds of millions of customers through raw startups Applied Semantics, Fetch and RadicalMail to established titans Google (AdSense, Picasa, Google Apps), Microsoft (FrontPage) and Ticketmaster (client and consumer apps). Having worked on everything from enterprise software, machine learning, communications, messaging, email, structured data, consumer ecommerce, and machine vision systems deployed from hugely-scalable platforms, Mike is uniquely qualified to lead the evolution of Sixgill Sense from today’s nascent proximity applications to the coming surge of device populations and streaming instructions in the billions, reliant on real-time proximity comprehension.

Learn More ∨
SHAWN GUNN
Senior Vice President, Business Development
Shawn has accumulated nearly unparalleled mobile, location services and movement analytics expertise serving as ecosystem builder at a succession of mobility markets innovators.

After beginning his career as a financial trader, Shawn built his mobility career brick-by-brick leading business development and strategic partnership functions at Globalspec, Traffic.com, NAVTEQ and Nokia, with a detour as a consultant at Hearst Digital along the way. Not merely a senior relationship executive, Shawn brings Sixgill a recurring history of connecting the ecosystem building of business development to hard revenue, and monetization of ancillary services.

Learn More ∨
ARNOLD WALDSTEIN
Senior Vice President, Marketing
Beginning at Atari and since then weaving both consumer and enterprise experiences, Arnold amassed expertise turning ideas into products, vision into brands and communities into markets.

He has blended classic market-making and constituency-building programs with hard revenue-producing development and structuring of channels to help a succession of innovators find revenue traction and scale demand for rapid growth and equity value. Arnold took his consumer chops honed at Atari to professional video editing pioneer Digital FX, and then launched the consumer multimedia revolution at Creative Labs with the launch of the Soundblaster card. Serving as the chief marketer at Electric Communities, Moai Technologies, Keynote Systems and RealD gave Arnold a decade of enterprise and technology B2B experience, during which he was able to blend the audience-expanding excitement of consumer marketing with the ROI, technology vetting and results focus of enterprise procurement to engineer market comprehension and sustained growth.

Learn More ∨
JOHN DOHM
Platform Technology Advisor
His title might include the term "Advisor," but we think of John as one of us. John is an unusual hybrid in technology career terms.

He began as a software engineer for internal enterprise systems and spiraled away from his keyboard enough to gather up an ever-widening range of technology creation, scaling, architecture, deployment, operations and and general executive experiences. In a succession of companies including Quaker, Deloitte, American Standard, Intellos, Guru Denim and RealD, John worked on networking infrastructure, internal ERP, inventory, CRM and HR systems, vehicle control and telematics systems, and managed global IT operations. For the past several years, including his half-decade thus far at RealD, John has been thinking seriously about how to solve tracking of mobile distributed assets and thus became interested in Sixgill. Aside from John’s continuing interest in technology enabling highly scalable systems, his prior experience in the CIO function gives us valuable buyer perspective about our enterprise proximity service.

Learn More ∨

The Board

HARRY HOPPER
Executive Chairman
  • 25+ years investing in Telecom/Mobile/IT
  • Columbia Capital, Managing Partner (20 yrs; $2B fund)
  • Forbes Midas List
  • Boards: Open Mobile, Mobile Posse; LendPro. Former: MetroPCS (PCS); Equinix (EQIX), Pegasus (PGTV), DSL.net (DSLN): Private 5 mobile operators, 10 Media, IT Service Co.'s
  • President telecom investment bank, Entrepreneur/Founder 2 venture backed co.'s
PHIL RESSLER
CEO

Phil has been serially involved in building companies and expanding markets for a wide range of innovators in enterprise data availability, comprehension and collaboration spanning the mobile, web, networking and PC eras. See Phil’s full bio above in Team.

CHRISTOPHER ROGERS
Director
  • Co-Founder of Nextel Communications
  • Director at LightSquared, PlayStar, and
    the Wireless Board Registry
  • Partner at Lumia Capital

Learn how Sixgill can help your business.
LEGAL   CONTACT
© Copyright Sixgill, 2016. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Home video text
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded: Mobility in business is a permanent trend. Enterprise need for control never ends. You don’t have to choose. Champion both.

item.title: Home text 2
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
We are experts in helping you
track, determine and act
on the ever-changing relationships between people, places and things essential to your success.

With our market-proven enterprise proximity platform, customers can Track the key people, places, and things that matter to them, Determine proximity and intent, and Act to drive business value.

We turn the increasing mobility of the enterprise workforce and the connected nature of the Internet of Things into a business asset, converting vast amounts of location and sensor data into understandable analytics and targeted action.

Our proximity engine—at the heart of the platform—has normalized 1.5 billion multidimensional measurements and triggered 25 million context-sensitive actions for our customers. And counting.

item.title: Home text 3
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
Sixgill SenseTM tracks, determines, and acts on the
changing proximity of people, places and things.

Proximity for People
Trigger messages to employees
based on their location.

Proximity for ASSETS
Track assets as they are being
manufactured and moved from
building to building.

item.title: Home crowds proximity
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
Proximity for CROWDS
Direct event attendees toward optimal
travel routes to decrease congestion
and improve their experience.

item.title: Legal content
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
Sixgill, LLC – Privacy Policy

Sixgill, LLC (“Sixgill”) values the privacy of our users. This Privacy Policy describes Sixgill’ policies and procedures on the collection, use, and disclosure of Your information. This Privacy Policy is subject to the Sixgill Terms and Conditions of Use. Your use of Sixgill Products and Services (also “Software”) and any information You provide remain subject to the terms of this Privacy Policy. This Privacy Policy is available at www.xxx.xxxx. Please read the following to learn more about our privacy policy.

What This Privacy Policy Covers [OR] The Information Sixgill Collects

This policy covers how Sixgill treats personal information that Sixgill collects and receives, including information related to Your use of the Sixgill Website(s), Your current and past use of Products and Services provided by Sixgill, directly or through third parties, and/or the Website and/or Application Stores authorized to carry Sixgill Products and Services.

Personal information is information about You that is personally identifiable like Your name, address, email address, or phone number, location, and device information, and that is not otherwise publicly available.

Sixgill may utilize information that it obtains from You to collect additional information about You from business partners or other companies and may combine information that it obtains from You with information from business partners or other companies.

This information may include, but not be limited to:

Website Information: When You register with Sixgill or when You use Sixgill Products and Services, You may choose to provide certain personally-identifiable information including, but not limited to Your name, email address, mobile phone number, LinkedIn account information, address, birth date, gender, cell phone service provider, places of interest to You, Your personal habits, occupation, industry, personal interests, relationship information, lifestyle information, social media interactions, and personal pictures/photographs. This policy only applies to websites owned or operated by Sixgill. This policy does not apply to any other websites or to the practices of companies that Sixgill does not own or control, or to people that Sixgill does not employ or manage. Sixgill Websites may contain links to third-party websites that are not owned or controlled by Sixgill. Sixgill has no control over, and assumes no responsibility for, the privacy policies or practices of any third-party websites. Information on such third-party websites may be obtained directly from those third-parties, possibly from their websites.

Registration Information: When You register with Sixgill and/or the Sixgill Website(s), and sign in to or use our services, directly or through third party applications or services, You are not anonymous to us. For certain services, we may request credit card or other payment account information which we maintain on secure servers. Sixgill collects information about Your transactions with us and with some of our business partners, including information about Your use of Products and Services that we offer. This information may include, but is not limited to any combination of phone number, email address, UDID, and/or device MAC address. Sixgill collects any attribute information that You provide that is relevant and/or required to offer Sixgill Products and Services.

Location Information: When You use Sixgill Products and Services Sixgill can collect location information and sensor data provided by Your device. This information may include, but is not limited to: GPS data (including, but not limited to device latitude/longitude, accuracy, heading, speed, and altitude), cell tower and Wi-Fi access point information.

Device Information: Sixgill automatically receives and records (collects) information from any device You use to view, register or download Sixgill Products and Services including, but not limited to, Your cell phone, tablet, PDA computer, personal computer, browser, car, appliances and M2M devices. Such records and information may include, but not be limited to, device-specific information, such as device UDID, device phone number, Your IP address, cookie information, software and hardware attributes, and the web page(s) You request.

Cookies and Website Data: Sixgill may set and access cookies on Your computer. A cookie is a small data string our server that writes to Your hard drive. This data string contains Your unique user ID for our Website. This technology also allows us to customize Your experiences when You visit the Sixgill Website(s). For example, we may be able to deliver content specific to Your interests, keep track of Your online ordering and alert You to new products.

Sixgill may let other companies that show advertisements on some of our pages set and access their cookies on Your computer. Other companies’ use of their cookies is subject to their own privacy policies, not this one. Advertisers or other companies may have access to Sixgill’ cookies.

Sixgill collects non-personally identifiable information regarding Your visits to the Sixgill website(s). Cookies contain a session identification number that our systems use to recall previous authentication or order information from our servers. We may also collect Your domain name, IP address, the address of the last URL You visited prior to coming to our Website, and Your browser and platform type. We may use our or a third party navigation and localization services to target advertisements and content based on where You are located. We may use our or a third party tracking service to help us analyze this information in the aggregate to evaluate the effectiveness of our site, Products and Services. In some cases, the information is collected directly by the third party and in others it is forwarded by Sixgill to the third party.

A cookie cannot be used to access or otherwise compromise the data on Your hard drive. Your privacy is always protected. However, at any time You may choose to change Your browser settings to disable cookies if You do not want us to establish and maintain a unique website user ID for You. Please be aware that cookies may be required to complete certain functions on the Sixgill Web site(s), such as ordering online. Please consult the instructions provided by Your browser provider to change Your browser settings, remove cookies or to disable cookies.

Sixgill uses information for the following general purposes to: provide services that You activate or for other Products and Services, improve our services, contact You, conduct research, provide anonymous reporting for internal and external clients, and for sale to other clients or third parties in non-aggregated and aggregated forms (but only as set forth below).

The only way to prevent Sixgill from collecting personal information about You is to not use our Website, Products, Services and/or software, directly or through our business partners and other third parties who use our Products and Services as part of their offerings. Sixgill retains some historical personal information obtained through Your use of Sixgill Products and Services even after their removal from Your devices. (See “Discontinuing Use of Sixgill Products and Services”)

Information Sharing and Disclosure

When Sixgill has Your permission (See “Your Consent” below) or under the following circumstances, Sixgill may rent, sell, or share personal information about You with other people or non-affiliated companies to provide products or services You have requested, or to present targeted advertising and content for You to see. We provide the information to trusted partners who work on behalf of or with Sixgill under confidentiality agreements. These companies may use Your personal information to help Sixgill communicate with You about offers from Sixgill and our marketing partners.

Sixgill reiterates that Sixgill, the Website(s) and all Sixgill Products and Services are not designed or intended to attract children under the age of 13 as users and Sixgill does not intentionally collect personal information from such children. However, if a parent/guardian permits their child under age 13 to register with Sixgill, to use the Website, and/or to use Sixgill Products and Services, then that parent/guardian is permitting Sixgill to collect and use their child’s personal information in the same manner set forth herein that Sixgill uses any other user’s personal information.

Sixgill responds to subpoenas, court orders, or legal process, or to establish or exercise our legal rights or defend ourselves against legal claims. Sixgill believes it is necessary to share information in order to investigate, prevent, or take action regarding illegal activities, suspected fraud, situations involving potential threats to the physical safety of any person, violations of the Sixgill Terms and Conditions of Use, or as otherwise required by law.

Sixgill may disclose or transfer the information upon the closing of a definitive agreement under which a majority of the outstanding stock or assets of Sixgill are acquired by a 3rd party.

Sixgill may display targeted advertisements and content based on Your personal information. Advertisers (including advertisement serving companies) may assume that people who interact with, view, or click targeted advertisements meet the targeting criteria, for example, women ages 18-24 from a particular geographic area. However, not all advertisements and content may be appropriate for You. If You disapprove of advertisements or content targeted to You, Your only choice to prevent further such advertisements or content being shown to You is to discontinue use of the Sixgill Website(s), Products and Services.

Access to information is limited to only those employees, contractors, agents and affiliates of Sixgill who have a reasonable need to access such information in the official performance of their duties.

Sixgill may disclose location information if required to do so by law or in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to (a) conform to a legal order or comply with legal process served on Sixgill; (b) protect and defend the rights or property of Sixgill; or (c) act in urgent circumstances to protect the health and safety of any persons.

Sixgill does not notify its users when their personal and/or location information has been disclosed to partners or 3rd parties.

Data Retention Policy/Managing Your Information

Sixgill indefinitely retains current and historical personal information and location data obtained through Your use of Sixgill Products and Services. Sixgill retains such information to improve its Products and Services and for Sixgill Products and Services to function properly. Sixgill may be required to retain certain information by law.

Confidentiality and Security

Sixgill is concerned about safeguarding the confidentiality of Your information. Sixgill provides physical, electronic, and procedural safeguards that comply with federal regulations to protect information we process and maintain. Sixgill limits access to personal information about You to employees who Sixgill believes reasonably need to come into contact with that information to provide products or services to You or in order to do their jobs. Sixgill has physical, electronic, and procedural safeguards to protect personal information about You. Please be aware that, although we endeavor to provide reasonable security for information we process and maintain, no security system can prevent all potential security breaches.

Discontinuing Use of Sixgill Products and Services

At any time You may elect not to use Sixgill Products and Services and/or receive messages from us. You can stop all further collection of personal information by deleting and/or uninstalling Sixgill Products and Services from all devices containing Sixgill Products and Services, including, but not limited to, computers, hard drives, networks, mobile phones, tablets, appliances and M2M devices. Note: Sixgill may indefinitely retain historical location data obtained through Your use of Sixgill Products and Services. Sixgill may retain such information to improve its Products and Services and for Sixgill Products and Services to function properly. Sixgill may be required to retain certain information by law.

Removing Sixgill Products and Services from Your devices may prevent You from receiving email messages regarding updates, improvements, or special offers.

Special Note Regarding Children

Sixgill believes that protecting the privacy of children on the Internet is very important. The Sixgill Website, Products and Services are not designed to attract children under the age of 13, and Sixgill does not intentionally collect personal information from such children. Ordering online products, services and information is limited to adults 18 or over. Children should exercise caution before providing personal information online and should discuss with an adult or guardian before doing so. Sixgill also urges parents and guardians to consider using one of the low-cost programs designed to protect children while they are online.

Notice to Residents of Countries outside the United States of America

Sixgill is headquartered in the United States of America. Personal Information may be accessed by us or transferred to us in the United States or to our affiliates, business partners, or service providers elsewhere in the world. By using our Website(s), Products and Services, directly or through third parties, You consent to this transfer.

Changes to this Privacy Policy

Sixgill may update this policy from time to time for any reason. Sixgill will notify You about significant changes in the way we treat personal information by posting the new Privacy Policy on the Sixgill website (http://www.sixgill.com/legal).

Your Consent

By using Sixgill Products and Services You are consenting to our collection and processing of Your personal information as defined above. “Processing” means using cookies on a personal computer, tablets, mobile phones and devices or using or touching information in any way, including, but not limited to, collecting, storing, deleting, using, combining and disclosing information.

California Privacy Rights

Pursuant to Section 1798.83 of the California Civil Code, residents of California can obtain certain information about the types of Personal Information that companies with whom they have an established business relationship have shared with third parties for direct marketing purposes during the proceeding calendar year. In particular, the law provides that companies must inform consumers about the categories of Personal Information that have been shared with third parties, the names and addresses of those third parties, and examples of the types of services or products marketed by those third parties. To request a copy of the information disclosure provided by Sixgill pursuant to Section 1798.83 of the California Civil Code, please contact us by writing us at the following address:

Sixgill, LLC
312 Arizona Avenue
Santa Monica, California 90401

Questions and Suggestions

If You have questions or suggestions You can contact Sixgill via the contact information contained on our Website or at:

Sixgill, LLC
312 Arizona Avenue
Santa Monica, California 90401

revised: 3/15/2016

item.title: Tech text 1
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
Technology
that simplifies your
world

Sixgill Sense technology was designed for the new mobile, distributed, connected workplace, where enterprise effectiveness will be determined in part by how effectively the burgeoning ad hoc mobility and continuous movement of people and assets are managed.

Sixgill combines a market-tested set of proximity technologies with an open architecture that allows enterprises to seamlessly integrate this new capability into existing business processes and software. The result is a proximity PaaS that provides both insight into the activity of the enterprise and a way to drive proximity-induced actions based on business goals.

item.title: Tech text 2
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
Sixgill uses a multi-pronged location awareness approach to best determine people and asset location, including GPS, cellular network location, WiFi access points, and Bluetooth beacons. As new ways of determining location become available, Sixgill will support them.

Sixgill’s lightweight mobile SDK, Reach, turns an enterprise mobile application into a two-way proximity-informed app, able to pass location information to Sixgill for proximity determinations, and communicate relevant, contextual information to employees based on where they are. Sixgill Reach (iOS, Android, Windows Mobile) balances device battery life with responsiveness required by an anticipated proximity event. Sixgill can integrate signals from other connected devices as well, allowing for business goals around the proximity of people and key assets.

item.title: Tech text 3
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
At the heart of Sixgill Sense is the ability to determine proximity circumstances from location data, and take appropriate action. Users define business outcomes that are triggered based on proximity determinations, other sensor data and user attributes. User attributes can be defined within Sixgill Sense or integrated via API.

When people, places or things enter, exit, or dwell within a landmark, Sixgill’s dynamic decision engine takes the right action, whether it’s one proximity event or millions to evaluate and act upon. Actions can reference a wide variety of signals, including complex polygons drawn on a map, imported lat/long data, connection to a specific WiFi access point, a given signal strength from a network beacon or access point, or any combination of these. The engine can also incorporate sequential events in the rules logic.

item.title: Tech text 4
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
Sixgill Sense is designed to work with an enterprise’s existing systems along with existing and future location technologies. It is an agnostic, open platform that can integrate with a wide array of sensor and data inputs and virtually any activity service.

The rules engine can incorporate data and attributes from existing enterprise systems, as well as third party content for better decisions. On the output side, Sixgill can integrate with messaging and enterprise systems, internal databases or third party software to utilize existing processes.

Sixgill Sense APIs allow enterprises to utilize Sixgill Sense as a service in any device, OS or data environment. From defining business logic to driving specific actions to accessing proximity data, Sixgill APIs allow full access to the Sense proximity platform’s functionality.

item.title: Product text 1
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
PRODUCTS

Sixgill’s cloud-based enterprise proximity platform enables your business to take control of your connected, mobile world and drive business value. From insightful analytics to precision actions based on the proximity of your people and mobile assets, Sixgill will make your business more productive and effective.

item.title: Product text 2
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
The Proximity Engine for Enterprise

Sixgill Sense tracks, determines, and acts on the changing proximity of people, places, and things. Your world is complex. Today’s enterprise has an ever-expanding mobile workforce and increasingly sophisticated, connected assets. Sixgill Sense allows you to understand and harness this mobility and use it to your advantage, gaining awareness and insight, and driving contextual, proximity-based actions to make your organization safer, more productive and profitable.

TRACK YOUR MOBILE ENTERPRISE
Sixgill Sense integrates location and sensor data from your mobile workforce and assets, enabling insight and action on your mobile and connected enterprise. By using the the Sixgill Reach mobile SDK to connect your mobile app to Sixgill Sense, you can avoid expensive specialized location equipment and take advantage of Sixgill’s hybrid location and battery optimization features. Sixgill Sense can also incorporate any location-emitting connected devices or assets with onboard sensors.
  • Locate a person or an important connected asset
  • Get a view of where all of key people or connected assets are from the Sixgill dashboard, or use our Data API to utilize your existing analytics software for detailed analysis
  • Understand location history and migration patterns to optimize productivity and planning
DETERMINE PROXIMITY AND INTENT

The Sixgill Sense proximity engine combines location and sensor data with business intent to drive action on the proximity events that matter for your business. Users can configure or import key business rules for Sixgill Sense to monitor in real time. For even smarter proximity determinations, integrate your existing enterprise systems to incorporate user attributes, corporate policies or other important internal information.

  • Drive contextual, specific actions based on flexible set of rules, using user attributes, geospatial targeting, and contextual triggers
  • Combine your existing business systems, data and processes with new proximity awareness, to drive smarter actions
  • Utilize an array of predefined proximity circumstances and flexible location targeting, including wifi or beacon signals, points of interest, complex polygons, circles, and exclusion areas. Proximity presets include: Enter Area, Exit Area, In-Area, Out-of-Area, Device-to-Device
ACT TO DRIVE BUSINESS VALUE

Sixgill Sense can trigger actions from proximity knowledge that you need to accomplish your business goals. Whether the scenario calls for a message to a user, a critical piece of information logged into a corporate database, or an alert placed in another enterprise system, Sixgill Sense can do it. Trigger a push notification, send an email, serve content, or log data into your CRM system, for example. Sixgill’s open API can integrate with your existing applications, data repositories or other third party tools.

  • Utilize Sixgill’s integrated push notifications, text, or email to communicate high value, contextual messages. Customize messages singly or by group with sensed or assigned variables
  • Post updates or trigger business logic on your existing enterprise systems
  • Integrate with best-of-breed communications software

item.title: Product text 3
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
The Mobile SDK for Sixgill Sense

Your app is already powerful; add the power of proximity awareness with the Sixgill Reach mobile SDK. The Sixgill Reach integrates seamlessly within your mobile app, creating a channel for hybrid location and sensor data to be communicated to Sixgill Sense and enabling contextual triggered messaging through your application. The Sixgill Mobile SDK is available for iOS, Android and Windows Mobile today.
  • Derive highly accurate and reliable location and proximity from multiple sources including GPS, cellular network location, Wi-Fi access points, and Bluetooth beacons
  • Optimize device battery life through smart technology that considers business objectives, device location and proximity, and available location technologies

item.title: Product text 4
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
Professional Services for Proximity Enablement

Our team follows a Sixgill process vetted by our multinational customers with proven success in speedy, scalable deployments.
  • Professional services
  • Data integrations
  • Application integrations
  • App development
  • Client success
  • SDK integration
  • Platform administration and reporting
  • Rules configuration

item.title: Solutions text 1
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
SOLUTIONS
Sixgill can help your business embrace mobility and gain control of your evolving connected and mobile world. Your workforce and critical assets are in motion more than ever before, creating opportunities and challenges throughout your business.

The ability to track, determine, and act in this mobile world is becoming a critical enterprise need. Sixgill automates the proximity data services necessary to support the complete spectrum of problem-solving packaged and custom mobility applications proliferating across the enterprise.

item.title: Solutions text 2
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
PEOPLE - "Proximity for People"
People are at the heart of your business. They are constantly moving, within your facilities and outside. Making them productive, motivated, and safe is a key driver of business success.

Sixgill provides you the ability to harness this mobility, turning it into a business asset. By understanding the location of your workforce and the proximity of people to the things that matter, you can make them more productive, accountable, efficient and safe.

Whether providing individual direction to an employee or understanding the movements of your entire team, Sixgill can assist you.

Here are a few examples of how Sixgill can help:

  • Provide wayfinding for employees on a corporate campus, including the ability to find key colleagues and deliver content to orient them to current context in real-time
  • Optimize home location for a sales or service team based on an analysis of historical team location and movements
  • Know where a critical employee is right now or verify that employees are where they are supposed to be
  • Understand where employees are in the event of an emergency and send targeted guidance to individuals based on their location and attributes
  • Let employees know when they are entering restricted areas
  • Trigger specific safety messages to employees when they enter hazardous areas
  • Validate and store movement data for analysis, audit, and compliance needs

item.title: Solutions text 3
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
ASSETS - "Proximity for Assets
Today, business assets and equipment are increasingly connected and mobile. Understanding their location and proximity to key people and locations is key to unlocking their effectiveness. Tomorrow, the ability to effectively manage a constellation of connected assets will become critical to being competitive.

With the emergence of asset connectivity due to the Internet of Things revolution, Sixgill simplifies the ability to track, determine, and act on the location and proximity of this key driver of business value.

Here are a few examples of how Sixgill can help:

  • Know where critical equipment or inventory is right now and verify that employees are where they are supposed to be
  • Connect the location of key equipment with people who need it based on their proximity and attributes
  • Get notified when valuable assets are moved from a building or a controlled access area
  • Analyze the movement of assets to gain insight into whether things are where they need to be

item.title: Solutions text 4
item.dc:creator: weezlabs
item.content:encoded:
CROWDS - “Proximity for Crowds
When crowds of people assemble at events, it always presents a set of unique challenges. How should they be directed? What safety precautions should be taken? How can you market to them effectively?

Sixgill can provide immediate feedback on crowd behaviors as well as a mechanism to communicate context specific information, guidance and offers.

A sample of the wide variety of benefits that Sixgill can provide includes:

  • Understand how to optimize the event setup based on real-time and historical paths of attendees
  • Message important, context-sensitive information to attendees in the event of a safety concern. Sixgill can also detect sudden mass movements that might indicate an emergency and alert your security war room or authorities to investigate
  • Direct attendees toward optimal travel routes (or parking) based on real-time and historical location data
  • Trigger important information for attendees to enhance their experience including targeting promotions, event information, and weather alerts
  • Serve an event’s global interest constituency while selectively addressing sub-populations determined by proximities
